item.title: About
item.description:
I am a science manager and data science/AI expert working at the intersection of research, technology, and strategy.

I currently serve as Team Lead and Head of Information & Data Science at the Helmholtz Association head office. In this role, I work on organizational strategy, data-driven initiatives, and the responsible application of AI across a large research landscape.

In addition, I serve as Visiting Professor at the University of Hertfordshire.

item.title: Consulting
item.description:
I advise organizations and teams on high-impact challenges in data science and AI, combining deep technical expertise with senior science management experience.

Typical engagements include technical reviews, strategy and readiness work, evaluation and benchmarking, and advisory support for data governance and responsible AI.

I bring hands-on experience in securing academic funding (ca. 3M€) and in reviewing competitive proposals—insight that helps teams design evaluation-ready projects.

I work with research-driven organizations, R&D teams, and public-sector initiatives. If you’d like to explore a collaboration, feel free to get in touch.

item.title: Selected Work
item.description:
This page highlights selected leadership, strategy, and technical contributions.
I keep this curated rather than exhaustive.

Flagship highlights

Leading Information & Data Science across Helmholtz (2023–present)

As Head of Information & Data Science at Helmholtz head office, I coordinate strategy and execution across 18 research centres and six research fields, connecting a network of professionals spanning AI, data science, and IT leadership.

Building an innovation pipeline that secured >20M€ funding

I initiated and led multiple Information & Data Science incubator workshops, resulting in large-scale strategic programmes on foundation models for scientific research, software engineering, and benchmarking.
